question: Vertical banding gastroplasty, also known as stomach stapling is done for?
exp: ANSWER: (D) Morbid obesity. REF: Sabiston Textbook of Surgery, 18th ed. Chapter 17. Bariatric operations produce weight loss as a result of tw. To factors. One is restriction of oral intake. The other is malabsorption of ingested food. Bariatric Operations: Mechanism of Action: Restrictive. Vertical banded gastroplasty (VBG) (historic purposes only). Laparoscopic adjustable gastric banding (LAGB). Largely Restrictive/Mildly Malabsorptive Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (RYGB). Largely Malabsorptive/Mildly Restrictive Biliopancreatic diversion (BPD). Duodenal switch (DS)
